intro: Leontodon kralikii, commonly known as the Kralik’s hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Leontodon kralikii is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native range.
